image.altText: An artist's impression of a large hotel next to a body of water.

props.synopsis: A new law has forced the NT's sacred sites watchdog to clear the way for the NT government and a Singapore-backed developer to move forward with plans for a new Darwin Waterfront hotel, in a move one critic has labelled "legislative vandalism".

title.children: 'You lose out': Hotel plan passes sacred sites obstacle despite concerns

image.altText: A close-up of a man with dark hair, looking towards the ground.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright’s lawyers have confirmed they will file a notice of appeal within the next 48 hours, indicating it will be based on five different grounds.

title.children: Celebrity croc wrangler Matt Wright to appeal guilty verdict on five grounds

image.altText: A girl with dark hair using her hands to sign Auslan.

props.synopsis: Access to language is essential for the Deaf community, but it isn't always guaranteed — especially in isolated parts of Australia. Locals are advocating for more awareness and support this International Week of Deaf People.

title.children: Sofie is teaching her baby sister sign and wants other Australians to learn too

image.altText: A glass window building in the distance, foreground with green trees.

props.synopsis: An NT Supreme Court jury finds an Alice Springs man guilty of murdering his female partner in July 2023.

title.children: Alice Springs man found guilty of murdering partner with sledgehammer

image.altText: The silhouette of a woman leaning and holding a child.

props.synopsis: A shortage of foster carers in regional WA is pushing vulnerable children, especially First Nations kids, thousands of kilometres from their families, culture and country.

title.children: Kids forced off country in northern WA due to foster shortage

image.altText: A close up of young Aboriginal woman smiling, standing on running track, arms on hips, green and yellow 'Australia' singlet

props.synopsis: Arnhem Land teenager Briseis Brittain is set to represent Australia at the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi this month, competing in the 200m and 400m races.

title.children: Briseis wasn't born when Cathy Freeman won gold, but the moment fired a dream

image.altText: A large patch of land being used for farming, shot from above.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest crocodile farms, owned by a subsidiary of luxury label Hermès, is consistently irrigating with water containing E. coli concentrations almost 500 times the national guidelines.

title.children: Major Australian croc farm irrigating with water high in E. coli

image.altText: A man wearing a tie, carrying a stack of documents outside a courthouse.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for nine Alice Springs prisoners who rioted at the facility last year say the unrest was akin to a "pressure cooker release valve" amid "feelings of degradation and neglect".

title.children: Men sentenced over riot in Alice Springs prison 'pressure cooker'

image.altText: An architectural design shows a terracotta-coloured art gallery standing on a green lawn.

props.synopsis: A leading figure in Australia's art world has criticised the Northern Territory government for considering splitting up the lease for a building designed as a major new art gallery, describing the plan as "pure madness".

title.children: Leading art critic labels NT government gallery plan 'pure madness'

image.altText: The silhouette of a woman, indoors.

props.synopsis: Years of fighting have created a crisis among Ukrainian children, with thousands estimated to have been transferred to Russia, where some are placed in so-called "re-education camps".

title.children: Tania's parents took her to Russia, where she says they were 'brainwashed'

image.altText: Tight shot of a man seated at a microphone speaking.

props.synopsis: He was indicted on one count of making false statements and one count of obstruction of justice.

title.children: Former FBI director James Comey says he is innocent after being indicted

image.altText: Donald Trump gestures with his hands wide open sitting at a desk with an executive order in front of him in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has signed an executive order that he says will allay security concerns regarding Chinese influence on social media platform TikTok.

title.children: Trump signs TikTok executive order but who's in charge of the platform now?

image.altText: Mahmoud Abbas appears on a computer screen.

props.synopsis: Mahmoud Abbas addresses the UN by video after the US refuses him a visa, as Donald Trump vows he will "not allow" Israel to annex the West Bank.

title.children: 'Palestine is ours': Palestinian leader thanks Australia in UN speech

image.altText: Two technicians beside racks of equipment in a data centre.

props.synopsis: Slowed progress in AI is narrowing the gap between big tech's proprietary models and their cheaper, open source rivals.

title.children: The AI bubble is threatening to burst. That could be good for Australia

image.altText: Catspreview

props.synopsis: From an innovative ruck set up to an uncanny ability to play out the quarter, the perennially competitive Cats are knocking on the door of another flag.

title.children: How the unpredictable Cats baffled opponents on their way to the grand final

image.altText: Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles speaks at a press conference watched by WA Premier Roger Cook.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's planned meeting with the US president has "absolutely" no link to the expected finalisation of the Trump administration's review into the AUKUS security pact, Richard Marles says. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese–Trump meeting not linked to AUKUS review: Marles

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Govt won't budge on PBS amid threat of Trump pharma tariffs
Coalition 'strongly opposes' Trump tariffs on branded pharmaceuticals

image.altText: An island scene

props.synopsis: The Solomon Islands's province of Malaita made global headlines five years ago when it banned Chinese investment. But today, a new China-funded road project is on the way — and the people are all for it.

title.children: This Pacific island banned Chinese investment. Today, things have changed

image.altText: Photo illustration juxtaposes a coal plant cooling tower and a row of offshore wind turbines

props.synopsis: China baffles climate experts by setting the bar low with its 2035 emissions reduction target amid speculation the renewables superpower will most likely exceed its ambitions.

title.children: Renewables behemoth China surprises with soft climate target

image.altText: A medical worker injects a girl's arm with the 2020 flu vaccine.

props.synopsis: A new report finds out-of-pocket costs and eroding trust are contributing to a "concerning" decline in childhood vaccination rates.

title.children: Eroding trust and misinformation at the heart of declining vaccination rates

image.altText: antarctic sea ice drops below the summer average of two and four million square kilometres

props.synopsis: Temperatures above Antarctica have risen by 30C, in a rare event that could potentially flip Australia's spring weather for months.

title.children: Rare phenomenon could disrupt Australia's weather for months

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas is wearing a blue suit with a white button up shirt with cameras pointing at him

props.synopsis: The debate over Santos's Narrabri gas project reignites, with traditional owners condemning 'disgraceful' comments made by two state premiers.

title.children: Traditional owners slam SA premier for 'disgraceful' call on Santos gas project

image.altText: A Brisbane Broncos player runs forward with the ball as the Canberra defensive line gathers to stop him.

props.synopsis: Brisbane's forward pack is on notice to do their jobs and a bit more against Penrith in the preliminary final to cover the absence of Pat Carrigan.

title.children: Broncos must fill Carrigan void or perish

image.altText: Four people sitting on bleachers by an ocean pool; a woman in swimmers and a pink cap has her arms raised, pulling a funny face

props.synopsis: A new headphone theatre production is set among the swimmers and sunbakers at a NSW city's much-loved ocean pool.

title.children: 'Like a magic pair of goggles': Theatre show set at 100-year-old ocean baths

image.altText: Palestinian flags at a rally.

props.synopsis: The Australia Palestine Advocacy Network releases its first national register report to examine "the climate of fear, censorship, intimidation and punishment" experienced by students, teachers and members of the school community.

title.children: Anti-Palestinian racism 'unbelievably prominent' in schools, report says

image.altText: A middle aged man with a black suit speaks before media microphones.

props.synopsis: A Queensland mayor under investigation for misrepresenting his military, education and business credentials has announced his resignation.

title.children: Townsville mayor resigns weeks after show-cause notice

image.altText: FMNR Africa

props.synopsis: A Victorian scientist whose farming technique has revolutionised agriculture in Niger has been awarded an international peace prize.

title.children: Australian wins peace prize for farming idea feeding millions in Africa

image.altText: A woman walks over destroyed goods in an aisle.

props.synopsis: Hong Kong and cities in China's Guangdong province have reopened businesses and schools after the world's most powerful tropical cyclone this year.

title.children: Taiwan races to rescue missing, China cleans up after typhoon

image.altText: derailed freight train on paddock.

props.synopsis: A freight train derails following a crash with a truck carrying livestock in central west New South Wales.

title.children: Freight train derails after collision with sheep truck

image.altText: three boxes of french fries from different fast food outlets

props.synopsis: Cheap potato imports from India and China are threatening the livelihoods of Tasmanian growers, as stalled negotiations with potato giant Simplot leave some farmers about to plant this year's crop without a contract.

title.children: Why do hot chips cost so much while farmers take price cuts?

image.altText: A mugshot of a serious-looking young man staring directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: The FBI has searched the home of the man who opened fired on an Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility in Texas, finding notes that say he was acting alone and intended to target agents, not detainees.

title.children: Shooter intended to target ICE agents, not migrants: FBI

image.altText: The ball is bounced in the middle of an Aussie Rules oval, with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: Initially laughed off, these pioneers from Victoria were determined to challenge Australia's sporting status quo, and their legacy continues today.

title.children: Barassi line 'has to be moved' as AFL popularity grows in league country

image.altText: A close up of a stern Donald and slightly smiling Melania Trump while standing on an escalator.

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A viral Donald Trump moment, a retracted study and daylight saving time

image.altText: A large black ute parked on the street.

props.synopsis: New inner-city apartment blocks no longer have a minimum number of required parking spaces, but what does that mean for suburbs where parking is a hot commodity?

title.children: 'Our car's been egged twice': The suburbs where parking is a hot commodity

image.altText: A white and blue police car parked beside a yellow and blue police car.

props.synopsis: The drone flights occurred over several airports across the country throughout the week.

title.children: Denmark says 'professional actor' behind drone flights over multiple airports

image.altText: A split image of two men leaning over their desks

props.synopsis: Robert Carlyle plays an integral role in The Hack, co-starring fellow Glaswegian David Tennant, which digs deep into the News of the World phone-hacking scandal.

title.children: Robert Carlyle on the hacking scandal that brought down a Murdoch paper
